categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
# Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

## Bug Fixes
- Fixed relationship between entities and agents (PR #4223)
- Fixed exposure of Telegram types (PR #4287)
- Resolved external dependency issue (PR #4306)
- Fixed remote attestation action (PR #4305)
- Fixed GUI missing requirement indicator and tooltips after merge conflict (PR #4307)

## Features
- Enhanced GUI (PR #4300)
- Added CLI test suite (PR #4301)

## Other Improvements
- Added onboarding tour and functionality for enabling/disabling the input button (PR #4293)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository, focusing on various improvements and fixes:

- PR #4304 by Samarthsinghal28 adds LLM instrumentation capabilities
- PR #4301 by wtfsayo introduces a CLI test suite feature
- PR #4305 by HashWarlock fixes issues with the remote attestation action
- PR #4308 by harshal247 implements an API endpoint for querying trace data (ELI2-234)
- PR #4311 by michavie exports bootstrap plugin capabilities
- PR #4307 by tcm390 fixes GUI issues related to missing requirement indicators and tooltips that occurred after a merge conflict

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been recently reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4303 suggests ensuring that USE_LOCAL_AI is always set to true, submitted by user jmikedupont2.

2. Issue #4302 points out that Task.World is redundant, also reported by jmikedupont2.

3. Issue #4299 asks about handling content responses from the model, raised by transformer98.

4. Issue #4298 reports an inability to use the GOAT Plugin, submitted by praveen-kaia.

5. Issue #4309 mentions testing on a real Ubuntu system rather than a virtual machine, reported by wtfsayo.

These issues cover various aspects of the eliza project, from configuration settings to plugin functionality and testing environments.

Over the past two days (April 16-18, 2025), the elizaos/eliza repository showed consistent development activity. The project had a total of 11 new pull requests with 8 successfully merged. There were 5 new issues opened during this period. The project maintained strong contributor engagement with 12 active contributors on April 16-17, slightly decreasing to 11 active contributors on April 17-18.
sources: From 2025-04-16 to 2025-04-17, elizaos/eliza had 5 new PRs (3 merged), 4 new issues, and 12 active contributors.
From 2025-04-17 to 2025-04-18, elizaos/eliza had 6 new PRs (5 merged), 1 new issues, and 11 active contributors.
